content.description: From a wide slot in the back of the roof, do a looong reach to a right-facing hold and match. Control the swing and continue past good two-finger pockets to top out just right of Bad Ass. Some may find this problem easier barefoot.
content.protection: A pad under the start may actually be a hindrance since this roof is so low to the ground, but one for the topout moves would be nice.
content.location: On the right side of the roof, starting on the wide slot, climbing toward the finish of Bad Ass.

content.description: Start at the same holds as Bad Ass and climb left across the back of the roof, then make a big reach to a jug and exit the roof.
Start at the back wall and climb out the low roof on deep pockets, pinches, heel toes and bicycles to a perfect sloper at the lip. One of the best at the grade in Arizona.
content.protection: Lowball with a good landing. Bring a pad.
content.location: Left side of the roof, starts in the back at obvious chalked-up pockets

content.description: Bomber limestone with incredible features. Bad Ass is the sooper classic must-tick attraction, and Stinky Ass is tricky. There are also a couple linkups and variations. This roof can attract a crowd on weekends.
